Posts.EditableText:
Hey - like the sig Ste... Did you just used something simple to draw out a rough line and do some stuff to change the colour and "glow" effect.

I take it from your "it can be done" that you did it... Any info on that?
Posts.HTML:
Hey - like the sig Ste... Did you just used something simple to draw out a rough line and do some stuff to change the colour and "glow" effect.

I take it from your "it can be done" that you did it... Any info on that?

Posts.EditableText:
im actually using photoshop to do it. i have a plug-in which does it automatically, but there is an easy way to do it too.  if you have it just follow these instrutions....

Press D to put the pallette back to black and white

goto fliter -- render -- clouds
goto filter -- render -- Difference clouds
press Ctrl + I.  the picture should now be bright and you should start to see the lightning appear.

Goto Image -- Adjustments -- Levels -- put the middle arrow all the way to the left
Goto Image -- Adjustments -- Hue & Saturation, and choose the colour of the lightning.

Your new one is awesome i'd love to know how u did that
Posts.HTML:
im actually using photoshop to do it. i have a plug-in which does it automatically, but there is an easy way to do it too. if you have it just follow these instrutions....

Press D to put the pallette back to black and white

goto fliter -- render -- clouds
goto filter -- render -- Difference clouds
press Ctrl + I. the picture should now be bright and you should start to see the lightning appear.

Goto Image -- Adjustments -- Levels -- put the middle arrow all the way to the left
Goto Image -- Adjustments -- Hue & Saturation, and choose the colour of the lightning.

Your new one is awesome i'd love to know how u did that

Posts.EditableText: I used Flash to do it. I found that you can select a picture, delete it and use the shape tool to draw out the picture again - but in the respective places. So you get this window-like effect. You could also do it by putting squares over the picture and deleting the area's outside the boxes too Then I just put writing on it... The "Â© Computer Whizz" is done using a mask. That's about it really!
Posts.HTML:
I used Flash to do it. I found that you can select a picture, delete it and use the shape tool to draw out the picture again - but in the respective places. So you get this window-like effect.

You could also do it by putting squares over the picture and deleting the area's outside the boxes too

Then I just put writing on it... The "Â© Computer Whizz" is done using a mask. That's about it really!
